comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:7.0a2) Gecko/20110804 Firefox/7.0a2 Iceweasel/7.0a2
Build ID: 20110804042002

Steps to reproduce:

Firefox is great in that there are many ways to 'view source'.
However once one is inside of a "Soucre of:" window, there is no way
to do the opposite.

Sure one can click on the links inside such a source window, but that
just leads to more source.

No, you would think at least there would be a right menu option to
"view rendered link in other window", but no, it's a source lock-in.

And of course there is no menu item to view the rendered version of
the current document. You _just assume_ it is still available in
another window.

One at best must do a tedious copy and paste of such URLs into new
tabs, etc.

And don't tell me to add an add on.

> dupe of bug 469434, unless you want a "open in new tab/window"
bug 469434 is just give a dog a bone. I want a whole proper can of dog food.
Not only do I want a right mouse item for copying links while there in a source window, I also items for 'see source of this link in a new window' and **see rendered page for this link in a whole new genuine window/tab**. And also a top of window item in the menus to 'see this page rendered, in a whole new fresh tab/window" e.g., "browse the current source file in Firefox" (such a basic want!)
